publications.name: Political Issue or Public Health: the Vaccination Debate on Twitter in Europe
publications.summary: Exploration of the relationship between the political interest of social media users and their exposure to vaccine-hesitant content on Twitter in 17 European countries, finding that users following right-wing or anti-EU politicians are more likely to encounter such content during the early months of the pandemic.

publications.name: Impact of food-related conflicts on self-reported food insecurity
Global Misinformation Spillovers in the Vaccination Debate Before and During the COVID-19 Pandemic: Multilingual Twitter Study
publications.summary: Exploration of the global network of anti-vaccination communities on Twitter, and the role that content moderation efforts by Twitter had worldwide in reducing the spread of vaccine-related misinformation.

publications.name: Echoes through Time: Evolution of the Italian COVID-19 Vaccination Debate

publications.name: Collective Response to Media Coverage of the COVID-19 Pandemic on Reddit and Wikipedia: Mixed-Methods Analysis
publications.publisher: Journal of Medical Internet Research 22 (10) (2020), doi:10.2196/21597
publications.summary: Exploration of the relationship between media coverage, public response, and the COVID-19 pandemic, finding that media coverage drives public attention and raises questions about the impact of attention saturation on collective awareness and behavioral change.

publications.name: Epidemic spreading and aging in temporal networks with memory
publications.summary: Analysis of the effects of memory among individuals on the spreading of a disease using the activity-driven model.
